title: Here's How Jeremy Jones Takes Climate Action Every Single Day - Outside
summary: Pro snowboarder Jeremy Jones is passionate about climate change and takes action 365 days a year. Jones believes that everyone can be part of the climate movement, regardless of their political affiliation or lifestyle choices. He advocates for everyday actions, conversations, and supporting businesses that prioritize sustainability.

title: New Whitepaper Reveals Trillion-Dollar Opportunity for Corporate Climate Action in Asia - BCG
summary: A new report by the World Economic Forum in collaboration with Boston Consulting Group and SAP reveals that Asia could see big revenue and job benefits from targeted climate action. The report notes that a revenue opportunity of USD$4.3 trillion is available for Asian businesses by 2030 from activities like the expansion of renewable power, energy efficiency in buildings, and greater circularity in producing industries. Similarly, 58% of the jobs required to service those opportunities will be situated in Asia, creating as many as 232 million roles for the region.
green_innovation: TRUE, the report describes the opportunities for climate action in Asia, which includes the expansion of renewable power, energy efficiency in buildings, and greater circularity in producing industries.
business_innovation: TRUE, the report describes the revenue and job opportunities available for Asian organisations investing in corporate climate action.

title: Advancing Human and Planetary Health: Enabling Healthy Diets and Addressing Climate Change - Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations
summary: The FAO in Geneva Nutrition Dialogue Series focuses on actions to address obstacles to the advancement of agrifood systems transformation for healthy diets. The Initiative on Climate Action and Nutrition (I-CAN), launched by the Government of Egypt, WHO, FAO, GAIN, and other partners, aims to create an alliance between the nutrition and climate communities to implement policy actions that simultaneously improve nutrition outcomes and support climate change mitigation and adaptation. Country experiences from Malawi, Pakistan, and Ethiopia showcase practical examples across agrifood systems that can accelerate progress on climate change and nutrition.

The company has made significant strides in ramping up circular and low carbon solutions, accelerating interim greenhouse gas (GHG) emissions reduction targets, and contributing to a thriving society.  LyondellBasell is committed to transparency and demonstrating how it is making an impact as a leader in the chemicals industry.

title: Tillamook County Creamery Association Partners With New Seasons Market to Drive Climate Action; Jocelyn Bridson ... - Deli Market News
summary: Tillamook County Creamery Association (TCCA) and New Seasons Market (NSM) are partnering to create a regenerative agriculture project to sequester carbon and improve ecosystems on farms. The project will involve planting native trees and shrubs on regional dairy farms within the TCCA Cooperative. The riparian forest planting will begin over the winter of 2023–24 and will provide volunteer opportunities for staff of both B Corp partners.

title: These 8 Countries are Embracing Plant-Based Food for the Planet - VegNews
summary: Governments around the world are starting to take action to promote plant-based diets and support alternative protein development in order to mitigate the climate crisis. Some examples of these actions include: Germany's National Nutrition Strategy, which acknowledges the need to reduce meat consumption for environmental reasons; New York City's Vegan Fridays initiative, which provides plant-based meals to 930,000 children every week; and Taiwan's Climate Change Response Act, which includes a specific reference to the promotion of plant-based, low-carbon diets.

title: New York's Mannan Supermarket Partners with Charity Group to Improve Food Security - Progressive Grocer
summary: Independent halal grocer Mannan Supermarket and the Zara Charitable Foundation have teamed up to combat food insecurity among local children by providing a year's worth of fresh, culturally appealing products to 200 diverse families served by The Gaton Foundation. The program launched in early March with Mannan Supermarket donating a variety of foods to families through Richmond Hill High School. The initiative is particularly timely as SNAP and WIC benefits have been reduced, resulting in increased food insecurity among families.

title: Austria launches $16 million rebate scheme for residential storage - pv magazine International
summary: Austria has launched a new subsidy scheme for residential batteries. The Ministry of Climate Action and Energy is providing a total of €15 million ($16.1 million) to support the installation of new storage systems. The systems must be fully installed by authorized installers and the ratio of usable storage capacity must be at least 0.5 kWh per unit of installed renewables capacity.
green_innovation: TRUE; The article describes a new subsidy scheme for residential batteries that are used in combination with renewable energy. This scheme encourages the adoption of green technologies and supports Austria's goal of transitioning to a more sustainable energy system.
business_innovation: TRUE; The article describes a new subsidy scheme that supports the installation of new storage systems and the expansion of existing systems used in combination with renewable energy. This scheme provides financial incentives for businesses to invest in green technologies and develop innovative storage solutions.
green_product: TRUE; The article discusses a subsidy scheme for residential batteries that are used in combination with renewable energy. These batteries can store excess solar or wind energy and release it when needed, helping to reduce reliance on fossil fuels and promote the use of renewable energy.
green_process: FALSE; The article does not describe a specific green process.

title: Consumer Companies Must Innovate to Drive Impact on Climate - BCG
summary: Companies in the consumer packaged goods (CPG) sector are increasingly recognizing the importance of sustainability and are starting to invest in green innovation. While there is still a long way to go, some companies are making progress in developing new products and processes that are more sustainable. For example, Nestle is investing in plant-based alternatives to meat and dairy products, and AB InBev is developing new ways to source food sustainably. Consumers are also becoming more interested in sustainable products, and companies that can meet this demand are likely to be successful in the future.

title: Plastic-free produce: Are supermarkets and shoppers ready for loose fruit and veg? - Grocery Gazette
summary: Supermarkets are under pressure to reduce plastic packaging on fresh produce, with a target of eliminating it entirely by 2030. However, consumers are reluctant to buy loose produce due to concerns about hygiene and cost. Supermarkets are working to increase the availability of loose produce, but more needs to be done to educate and incentivise consumers to make the switch.

title: SFST's speech at High-level Dialogue cum Dinner - "Hong Kong's Unique Position as the Green Finance and Fintech ... - info.gov.hk
summary: Hong Kong is positioning itself as a leader in green finance and fintech, with initiatives such as the Green Technology and Finance Development Committee, the issuance of green bonds, and the launch of Core Climate for trading carbon credits. title: Crown Coaches invests in Viva Energy carbon neutral diesel | News - Australasian Bus and Coach
summary: Melbourne coach and bus operator Crown Coaches has signed on with Viva Energy to fuel its entire fleet with opt-in Carbon Neutral Diesel, a product certified by Climate Active. Viva Energy is continuing to explore the introduction of new low carbon fuels, products and infrastructure to address the needs of its customers.

title: The Battle for Net Zero Will Be Won or Lost in Asia - BCG
summary: Asia accounts for more than half of global primary energy consumption and greenhouse gas emissions, making it the pivotal region for climate action. Businesses in Asia have a critical role in driving the region towards net zero emissions and unlocking the associated economic growth and job creation opportunities. By taking immediate action, enabling transformation, and unlocking new growth, Asian companies can seize the climate opportunity and build a sustainable future.
